units.title: Passage hiPS cell colonies
units.text: To passage hiPS cell colonies, cells were incubated with 0.5 mM EDTA for 7 min at room temperature, resuspended in Essential 8 medium and distributed into new six-well plates.
units.rationale: Describes the step for detaching and replating hiPS cell colonies.

units.title: Puromycin selection of hiPS cells
units.text: Once the seeded cells reached 70–80% confluency, 1 µg ml−1 puromycin in StemFlex medium (Life Technologies, catalogue no. A3349401) was supplemented for 5 days.
units.rationale: Specifies antibiotic selection conditions for edited hiPS cells.

units.title: Dissociation and seeding for 3D hCO generation
units.text: To generate 3D hCO, hiPS cells were dissociated with accutase to obtain a single-cell suspension. About 3 × 10^6 cells were seeded per AggreWell 800 plate well in Essential 8 medium supplemented with the ROCK inhibitor Y27632 (10 µM).
units.rationale: Outlines how hiPS cells are prepared and seeded to form cerebral organoids.

units.title: Centrifugation and overnight incubation of AggreWell plate
units.text: The plate was centrifuged at 100 g for 3 min and incubated overnight at 37 °C with 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Details the aggregation step that promotes uniform embryoid body formation.

units.title: Transfer of aggregates to ultra‑low attachment dishes with patterning factors
units.text: The next day (day 0), cellular aggregates were transferred into ultra-low attachment plastic dishes (Corning, catalogue no. 3262) and cultured in Essential 6 medium (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. A1516401) supplemented with dorsomorphin (2.5 µM, Sigma‑Aldrich, catalogue no. 1614), SB-431542 (10 µM, R&D Systems, catalogue no. 1614) and XAV-939 (1.25 µM, Tocris, catalogue no. 3748).
units.rationale: Provides the medium composition and conditions for early organoid patterning.

units.title: Harvesting and concentration of viral supernatant
units.text: Media from transfected cells was harvested at 24, 48 and 72 h after transfection. Viruses were concentrated by spinning at 17,000 rpm at 6 °C for 1 h.
units.rationale: Describes the collection and ultracentrifugation step to obtain concentrated lentivirus.

units.title: Medium change schedule (day 6–24)
units.text: From day 6 to 24, medium was changed every 4 days.
units.rationale: Specifies the routine medium replacement timing during early organoid maturation.

units.title: Medium change schedule (day 44 onward)
units.text: From day 44, only neural medium without growth factors was used for medium changes every 4 days.
units.rationale: Indicates the switch to growth‑factor‑free medium for later-stage differentiation.

units.title: Assembly of hFA assembloids
units.text: To generate hFA, hCO and hSO were generated separately and assembled by placing them in close proximity in 24-well low attachment plates (Corning, catalogue no. 3473), which were placed slightly tilted in the incubator.
units.rationale: Explains how cortical and subcortical organoids are combined to form forebrain assembloids.

units.title: Preparation of sequencing libraries from genomic DNA
units.text: Sample-specific sequencing libraries were prepared from the extracted genomic DNA of each collected sample by amplifying and barcoding the lentivirally integrated sgRNA spacer sequence using the Herculase II Fusion DNA Polymerase (Agilent, catalogue no. 600679).
units.rationale: Details the PCR‑based workflow for generating libraries for CRISPR screen sequencing.
